summary: "Singin' in the Rain" is a classic 1952 musical comedy film directed by Gene Kelly and Stanley Donen. It's about Hollywood in the 1920s when movies started using sound. Kelly, Donald O'Connor, and Debbie Reynolds play performers who must adapt to this change. The film was inspired by popular songs from that era. Although it didn't initially attract large audiences, it's now considered one of the best musical films ever made. It's been praised by many and is even preserved in the U.S. National Film Registry.
title: Singin' in the Rain
